intro: Lathyrus versicolor, commonly known as the variable vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pea-like flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with slender stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are an important food source for various wildlife. Lathyrus versicolor thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
